words.def: a cue given to a performer (usually the beginning of the next line to be spoken)

A blowing apparatus in which air, drawn into the upper part of a vertical tube through side holes by a stream of water within, is carried down with the water into a box or chamber below which it is led to a furnace.
cheap or pretentious or vain display
an easy victory
a support placed beneath or against something to keep it from shaking or falling
a formal ball held for a school class toward the end of the academic year
a place (seaport or airport) where people and merchandise can enter or leave a country
A note sounded on a horn at the death of a deer.
cleaning implement consisting of absorbent material fastened to a handle
An American alcoholic drink containing vodka and pomegranate juice.
an informal term for a father
(ethnic slur) offensive and derogatory name for a Black man who is abjectly servile and deferential to Whites
the upper part of anything
an athlete who plays for pay
A member of the Romani people.
metal or earthenware cooking vessel that is usually round and deep
select as an alternative over another
a clever remark
a state of decay usually accompanied by an offensive odor
a prominent rock or pile of rocks on a hill
Usually in plural orts A fragment; a scrap of leftover food; any remainder; a piece of refuse.
City in Burkina Faso (Proper noun)
op Op art ; a style of abstract art.
moment.
Toward a closed, touching or engaging position.
a state in northwestern United States on the Pacific
